entries.name: dustCompleted
entries.text: I am pleased to have The Dust of the Philosopher's Stone back in my possession. I thank you for your service. Now, you were interested in Koldo's Tomb?

children.name: veryMuch
children.response: Very well, then. Let me get my Kwikspell Book here. [flips through book for a minute.]

children.name: now
children.response: Yes! I have it. Here goes. [clears throat] "Abracadabra!"

children.name: didItWork
children.response: Yes, I do believe so. Koldo's Tomb is unlocked.

children.name: where
children.text: But where is it? I've looked everywhere.
children.response: It's up there. Back that way. You'll see.

entries.name: dustAccepted
entries.text: You found my dust yet? No? Then no need to stick around here.

children.name: hailBack
children.response: Welcome to one of my many summer dungeons. May I ask what brings you here?

children.name: koldosTomb2
children.response: Ahhh, I should have known. I suppose you want my help. Did Dedric send you?

children.name: iDoHeDid
children.response: I can help. But of course, quid pro quo, you're expected to take certain duties on board.

children.name: expectedNoLess
children.text: I expected no less. What did you have in mind.
children.response: I assume you're familiar with the Philosopher's Stone?

children.name: sorcersStone
children.response: I mean the Philosopher's Stone!! Bloody Americans. They mess up everything. Anyway, as you might have heard, it was destroyed back in 1992. However, "destroyed" is relative. We actually had it crushed into dust.

children.name: neverKnew
children.response: "Of course you didn't!!!" Dumbledore said calmly. Anyway, that dust still has powerful magical potential and I'd like it back. Go find it. It's around here somewhere.

children.name: accept
children.response: Thank you. Just head out that way, into the dark, dark abyss. And don't die.

children.name: reject
children.text: I don't know. This whole this is already taking too long.
children.response: You sure? Might be worth your while.
